1

LIA]52-lia

On any other night , [I]0-i loved living alone . Fucking loved it . Pants were optional and bras were such an afterthought they might as well not exist . On some days , they were shed at the door and flung onto the couch where [they]176-they ’d hang out for a couple hours while [I]0-i showered with the door open and walked around naked for no reason . Ninety percent of the time , in [[my]0-i little 18th Street apartment]177-my little 18th street apartment , [I]0-i was in some state of undress – in a T - shirt and panties or just panties . Sometimes a robe left untied . Sweats and a bra , perhaps ? Or maybe nothing at all . It was [my]0-i personal retaliation for having gone [my]0-i first twenty - five years without [[my]0-i own bedroom]178-my own bedroom – without [my]0-i own voice or taste or tiny lick of independence . Thanks to that late start , [I]0-i loved the freedom of living alone like [a normal person]179-a normal person loved [[their]179-a normal person mother]180-their mother or [spouse]181-spouse . But tonight was one of those nights that made [me]0-i kind of itch for [a roommate]182-a roommate . Mostly because [I]0-i did n’t want to be [the one to get up and investigate the bumping and thumping outside in the hall]183-the one to get up and investigate the bumping and thumping outside in the hall . It was almost 10:30PM – all [I]0-i wanted at this hour was to play some Sia , pour some wine and risk the safety of [my]0-i iPad as [I]0-i read it in the bath . [I]0-i wanted to paint [my]0-i toes in [Essie]50-stella rhys ’s Chinchilly , sleep by midnight and wake up early to start the custom order of truffles that had to be shipped to a Long Island wedding by Tuesday . So while it was selfish and vaguely bitchy , [I]0-i pretended not to hear [[my]0-i neighbor]184-my neighbor struggling out in [the hall]185-the hall . More often than not , it was [her]184-my neighbor finicky lock giving [her]184-my neighbor trouble , and generally , [I]0-i was the one who came to the rescue . But not tonight . “ [You]0-i ’ll figure it out , [Tess]53-tess , ”[0-i] [I]0-i whispered as [I]0-i finally let [myself]0-i close [my]0-i eyes and breathe in the lavender steam . [I]0-i sighed as [I]0-i leaned slowly back in the hot water , soaking in the Epsom salts and feeling them start to buzz against [my]0-i skin . But the second [my]0-i head touched [my]0-i bath pillow , a loud noise sounded outside . [My]0-i eyes flew back open as [I]0-i waited to hear it again . [I]0-i breathed out when several seconds of silence passed – even waited another few to be safe . Once [I]0-i ruled that [the coast]186-the coast was clear , [I]0-i grabbed [my]0-i glass of wine and relaxed once more . But [my]0-i back had barely hit the tub before the sound came back louder . Thump ! “ [Tess]53-tess ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i groaned to [myself]0-i , sitting up and staring out [my]0-i bathroom door . [I]0-i waited to hear a strike three but instead of a thump this time , it was a splintering crash . “ Shit ! ”[0-i] Water sloshed onto the floor as [I]0-i immediately jumped up and grabbed [my]0-i robe , [my]0-i heart beating fast as [I]0-i imagined [Tess]53-tess bleeding on the floor in [the hall]185-the hall , surrounded by a million shards of glass all because [I]0-i would n’t get out of [my]0-i bath . Shit , shit , shit . [I]0-i cursed [myself]0-i as [my]0-i feet tracked water all throughout [the house]188-the house till [I]0-i breathlessly reached the door , [my]0-i fingers unlatching all three locks at lightning speed before gripping the knob and swinging it wide open . And once the door was open , [I]0-i stared . Then [I]0-i stared some more . Holy … what . It was n’t [Tess]53-tess . [I]0-i knew that because [my]0-i eyes hit chest first – wide , hard chest stretching the soft cotton of a heather grey V - neck . [I]0-i could practically hear [my]0-i jaw creaking open as [my]0-i gaze then traveled north to broad shoulders , sculpted collarbones , and a square jaw boasting the kind of dark , trimmed stubble that made [my]0-i fingers twitch with the need to touch . Shit . [I]0-i had to catch [my]0-i breath when [our]189-our eyes finally locked , feeling legitimately smacked in the face with [this stranger]190-this stranger ’s gorgeousness . [He]190-this stranger was [an absolute wall of muscle and beauty with thick , dark hair and light green eyes]191-an absolute wall of muscle and beauty with thick , dark hair and light green eyes and for a moment [I]0-i forgot where [I]0-i was , because in what world did [a man who looked like this end up at [my]0-i door]192-a man who looked like this end up at my door ? “ Hi , ”[190-this stranger] [he]190-this stranger said with a faint smile . “ [Lia]52-lia , right ? ”[190-this stranger] [My]0-i head tilted . And in what world did [he]190-this stranger somehow know [my]0-i name ? “ [I]190-this stranger … ”[190-this stranger] [I]0-i failed to sort through all the questions at the tip of [my]0-i tongue . “ Hi , ”[0-i] [I]0-i finally said , letting go of [my]0-i mission to magically figure out what was happening . Instead , [I]0-i waited for [him]190-this stranger to introduce [himself]190-this stranger and tell [me]0-i who [he]190-this stranger was – whether [he]190-this stranger had in fact been plucked from the cover of [Men]193-men ’s Health or maybe some steamy billboard for [Calvin Klein]54-calvin klein . But instead [he]190-this stranger stood there a moment , brows up as [his]190-this stranger gaze dipped down to [my]0-i body – and only then did [I]0-i realize what [I]0-i barely had on . “ Shit , ”[0-i] [I]0-i hissed , grabbing [my]0-i robe and wondering how much of [me]0-i [he]190-this stranger ’d seen before [I]0-i remembered to actually tie the thing shut . “ [I]194-the stranger should probably be looking away , right ? ”[194-the stranger] [the stranger]194-the stranger asked . With a laugh . [I]0-i thought briefly about getting changed before [I]0-i helped with the door , but that meant that [my]0-i bath was over and that [my]0-i night had gone officially off - course , and [I]0-i stubbornly refused to entertain that notion . 18

[LUKAS]55-lukas

[I]0-i was eleven the first time [I]0-i saw snow . In real life at least – [I]0-i ’d seen plenty in movies . But [I]0-i had an irrational distaste for fake snow , probably because of [the house across [the street]260-the street]767-the house across the street . During Christmastime every year , [they]769-they taped piles of cheap cotton balls to [their]769-they windows to mimic mountains of snow . [I]0-i thought it looked fucking stupid but [Tess]53-tess was so charmed [she]53-tess used to take pictures , so it was no surprise at all that [she]53-tess bawled the first time [she]53-tess saw actual snow . [I]0-i was eleven , [she]53-tess was seven and [[our]770-our parents]408-our parents had made a random decision to put [us]770-our on [a plane]772-a plane two days before Christmas , sending [us]770-our to [[[our]770-our uncle]773-our uncle ’s house in [Philly]24-philly]774-our uncle ’s house in philly . [They]769-they ’d been fighting worse than usual the week prior , over something neither [Tess]53-tess nor [I]0-i could n’t understand , so despite the fact that [we]770-our were [untrusting kids who barely knew [this Uncle James]118-uncle james]775-untrusting kids who barely knew this uncle james , [we]770-our found [ourselves]770-our both eager to go . There had to be a thousand good memories from that short vacation but three stuck out most : [Tess]53-tess crying out of joy to see snow , [Uncle James]118-uncle james predicting [I]0-i ’d wind up at [Wharton]19-wharton and [me]0-i sneaking out Christmas night with [his]118-uncle james classic wood toboggan . It was probably 1AM when [I]0-i raced what felt like sixty miles an hour down [the street]260-the street . The wind whipped [my]0-i hair back and the cold stung the hell out of [my]0-i cheeks . [I]0-i knew that none of what [I]0-i was doing was safe and that it was a bad idea on multiple fronts , but [I]0-i doubled down anyway , switching positions mid - ride and lying on [my]0-i stomach to go headfirst down [the dark , icy road]777-the dark , icy road . [I]0-i was n’t sure when [I]0-i ’d get another snow so [I]0-i was going to make the best of it . For that reason , [I]0-i did n’t regret the cuts and bruises from getting launched off the sled at the end of [the road]778-the road . It was just how [I]0-i rolled from an early age – [I]0-i made smart , logical decisions ninety percent of the time . Then without warning , [I]0-i did something fucking stupid and reckless . [I]0-i ’d guess that putting [someone]1410-someone in [the hospital]1748-the hospital counted as [my]0-i reckless decision this year but whatever [I]0-i was doing with [Lia]125-lia this week probably came in at a close second . [I]0-i ’d slept over two nights in a row now . Could n’t help [myself]0-i though . [She]125-lia let [me]0-i so [I]0-i did . Neither night was planned – it just happened . It was also too damned easy to get out of bed in the morning , get changed for work across [the hall]185-the hall and come back in time to see [her]125-lia finally stirring in bed . There was something relaxing about watching [her]125-lia in bed , half - oblivious to [me]0-i . It was like the storm inside [me]0-i calmed every time [I]0-i looked at [her]125-lia rubbing sleep from [her]125-lia eyes . [I]0-i could n’t guess what that particular image did to [me]0-i but it struck some unknown chord inside [me]0-i that [Julian]65-julian would probably give [me]0-i hell for . But fuck it . [I]0-i was prepared for a bad week and if mornings with [Lia]125-lia softened the blow , then [I]0-i was going to enjoy as many as [I]0-i could , despite all the reasons telling [me]0-i to just nip it in the bud . [I]0-i was well aware of the strain between [us]782-we , ever since the night with [Julian]65-julian , [Emmett]79-emmett and [Bryce]116-bryce . [I]0-i could tell [she]125-lia was hurt by [my]0-i childfree admission . [I]0-i knew [I]0-i had no plans to change [my]0-i outlook despite that . [We]1324-we were a good five months away from meeting [him]2251-my son but [we]1324-we already knew [his]2251-my son name – [Nicholas Wyatt Hendricks]107-wyatt . [Nicholas]107-wyatt after [[Lia]125-lia ’s mother]1325-lia ’s mother , [Nicole]162-nicole , and [Wyatt]107-wyatt after [[my]0-i brother who would have been the best uncle]1326-my brother who would have been the best uncle – who [I]0-i knew was proud of [me]0-i , wherever [he]2251-my son was . It took [Lia]125-lia ’s help to get [me]0-i to that belief and whenever [I]0-i wavered , [she]125-lia was there to hold [me]0-i steady again . Because like [I]0-i was [hers]125-lia , [she]125-lia was [my]0-i anchor . [She]125-lia was [the woman who changed [me]0-i and [my]0-i life]1327-the woman who changed me and my life for the better , and every day , [I]0-i tried to find a different way to let [her]125-lia know . Of course , for the next fifty - two days , [I]0-i had a new method . Using the deck of cards [Lia]125-lia had bought at [the airport in [Spain]14-spain]1328-the airport in spain , just so [we]1329-we could pass time till [our]1329-we flight , [I]0-i ’d worked on a little project for [her]125-lia between [my]0-i breaks working on [the nursery]1330-the nursery . With a black Sharpie , [I]0-i ’d written one thing [I]0-i loved about [her]125-lia on every card .

21 . [I]0-i love the little sound [you]1331-you make when [you]1331-you stretch in the morning . 22 . [I]0-i love every time [you]1331-you introduce [me]0-i as [[your]1331-you husband]1332-your husband to [new people [we]1329-we meet]1333-new people we meet . 23 . [I]0-i love carrying [you]1331-you to bed because [you]1331-you fall asleep on [me]0-i every night on the couch . 24 . [I]0-i love when [you]1331-you kiss the back of [my]0-i hand . [I]0-i love the times [you]1331-you do it without even realizing .

It had been like this since [I]0-i ’d met [her]1334-she , but there were a million things [Lia]125-lia unknowingly did that made [me]0-i stop for a moment and thank [God]60-god with everything inside [me]0-i that [she]1334-she was [mine]1335-mine . Most of the time , it was nothing – a look exchanged in public , a random memory [she]1334-she ’d tell [me]0-i with excitement . On the outside , it looked like just another moment . But that made it even better .

25 . [I]0-i love the mundane moments [I]0-i fall deeper in love with [you]1331-you and [you]1331-you have no idea .

There were so many of those moments , and [I]0-i could n’t wait to collect more as [we]1336-we made the journey hand in hand , from [couple]1337-couple to [family]1625-family . [I]0-i could n’t do it without [Lia]125-lia , and [I]0-i could n’t live without [her]125-lia [She]125-lia was [[my]0-i happy place]1339-my happy place . And [I]0-i would n’t give [her]125-lia up for [the world]204-the world .

The End
